title: Kanha National Park
short_description: The largest national park in Madhya Pradesh, a lush sal and bamboo forest that inspired 'The Jungle Book'.
long_description: Kanha National Park, located in the Maikal range of Satpuras in Madhya Pradesh, is a vast expanse of grassland and forest. It is one of the most well-maintained National Parks in Asia. The park created history with its success in saving the Barasingha (Hard-ground Swamp Deer) from near extinction. The lush sal and bamboo forests, grassy meadows, and ravines of Kanha provided inspiration to Rudyard Kipling for his famous novel 'The Jungle Book'. It is a prime tiger reserve and offers excellent opportunities for sighting tigers, leopards, wild dogs, and the rare Barasingha.
wildlife_significance: Saved the Hard-ground Swamp Deer (Barasingha) from extinction. Prime tiger habitat.
major_experiences: Tiger tracking in Kanha, Kisli, Mukki, and Sarhi zones
Watching Barasingha in the grassy meadows
guides_and_tips: Mukki and Kanha zones are popular. Late afternoon drive to Bamni Dadar offers spectacular sunset views.
how_to_reach: By Air: Jabalpur (160 km) and Raipur (250 km). By Rail: Gondia and Jabalpur are convenient stations.
permits_and_fees: Permits available on MP Forest Department website.
conservation_notes: Exemplary management of grassland habitats. Village relocation program success story.
sample_itinerary: Day 1: Arrive and check-in. Afternoon safari in Kisli zone. Day 2: Morning safari in Kanha zone (Barasingha spotting). Visit Museum. Afternoon safari in Mukki zone. Day 3: Nature walk in buffer zone. Departure.
safety_tips: Wear earthy tones. Prepare for a dusty ride.
